hotels.name: The Grand Dragon Ladakh
hotels.description: Luxury hotel with mountain views, modern amenities, and excellent service.

hotels.name: Hotel Shangrila - Leh
hotels.description: Elegant hotel offering comfort and panoramic views, close to Leh market.

hotels.name: Lasermo Ladakh
hotels.description: Boutique hotel with garden, modern rooms, and friendly staff.

hotels.name: Hotel The Kaal
hotels.description: Budget-friendly hotel with spacious rooms and mountain views.

hotels.name: The Mogol Hotel
hotels.description: Modern amenities, comfortable rooms, and a peaceful environment.

hotels.name: The Druk Ladakh
hotels.description: Luxury hotel with beautiful decor and attentive service.

hotels.name: Hotel Gangba
hotels.description: Clean rooms, quality food, and friendly staff. Great mountain views.

hotels.name: Chospa Hotel
hotels.description: Modern hotel close to the market with comfortable rooms.

hotels.name: Ladakh Himalayan Retreat
hotels.description: Clean rooms, great food, and beautiful views from the balcony.

hotels.name: The Indus Valley
hotels.description: Elegant hotel in the heart of Leh with attentive staff and modern amenities.

eateries.name: Gesmo Restaurant
eateries.description: Famous for momos, yak cheese pizza, and breakfast options.

eateries.name: Lamayuru Restaurant
eateries.description: Popular for thukpa, butter tea, and Ladakhi cuisine.

eateries.name: Bon Appetit
eateries.description: Known for wood-fired pizzas, salads, and garden seating.

eateries.name: The Tibetan Kitchen
eateries.description: Popular for Tibetan specialties and rooftop dining.

eateries.name: Sky Wok Restaurant
eateries.description: Cozy place for Chinese and North Indian dishes.

eateries.name: Il Forno
eateries.description: Rooftop restaurant with Italian cuisine and great views.

eateries.name: Metta Cafe
eateries.description: Coffee, cakes, and light snacks in a relaxing setting.

eateries.name: Zig Zag Cafe
eateries.description: Chill cafe with a variety of food and drinks.

eateries.name: Lamayuru Cafe
eateries.description: Fresh bakery items and coffee, popular with travelers.

eateries.name: Little Italy
eateries.description: Italian dishes and pizzas, cozy ambiance.

attractions.name: Pangong Tso (Pangong Lake)
attractions.description: A stunning high-altitude lake known for its changing colors and scenic beauty.

attractions.name: Shanti Stupa
attractions.description: White-domed Buddhist stupa symbolizing peace, built by Japanese Buddhists.

attractions.name: Stok Palace
attractions.description: Royal palace of Ladakh’s former rulers, now a heritage hotel and museum.

attractions.name: Alchi Monastery
attractions.description: Ancient Buddhist monastery complex with remarkable statues and paintings.

attractions.name: Magnetic Hill
attractions.description: Gravity-defying hill where vehicles appear to roll uphill.

attractions.name: Royal Leh Palace
attractions.description: Nine-storey palace built in 1600, showcasing royal artifacts and panoramic views.

attractions.name: Tso Kar Lake
attractions.description: Saline lake on Rupshu Plateau, known for tranquility and natural beauty.

attractions.name: Chemrey Monastery
attractions.description: 400-year-old monastery with ancient Buddhist texts, located 40 km east of Leh.

attractions.name: Diskit Monastery & Maitreya Buddha Statue
attractions.description: Famous monastery in Nubra Valley with a 32m statue of Maitreya Buddha.

attractions.name: Fotu La Pass
attractions.description: Highest point on Srinagar-Leh highway at 4,108m, connecting through Zanskar Range.

faq.question: Do I need a permit to visit Pangong Lake?
faq.answer: Yes, Indian nationals require an Inner Line Permit. Foreigners need a Protected Area Permit.

faq.question: What is the best time to visit Leh-Ladakh?
faq.answer: The best time is from June to September when the weather is pleasant and roads are open.

faq.question: How to prevent altitude sickness in Leh-Ladakh?
faq.answer: Acclimatize for 1-2 days, stay hydrated, and avoid strenuous activity on arrival.

faq.question: Are ATMs available in Leh-Ladakh?
faq.answer: ATMs are available in Leh town, but carry cash for remote areas.

faq.question: Which mobile networks work in Leh-Ladakh?
faq.answer: BSNL and Airtel postpaid connections have the best coverage.

faq.question: Are roads to Leh open year-round?
faq.answer: No, Manali-Leh and Srinagar-Leh highways are open from June to October.

faq.question: How cold does it get in Leh-Ladakh?
faq.answer: Temperatures can drop below freezing at night, even in summer.

faq.question: Is vegetarian food available in Leh-Ladakh?
faq.answer: Yes, most restaurants offer vegetarian options.

faq.question: Are fuel stations available on highways?
faq.answer: Fuel stations are sparse; fill up in Leh before long journeys.

faq.question: What health precautions should I take?
faq.answer: Carry basic medicines, sunscreen, and consult a doctor if you have health issues.

transport.description: Kushok Bakula Rimpochee Airport connects Leh with major Indian cities.
Manali-Leh Highway (473 km) is open June–October; check weather before travel.
Srinagar-Leh Highway (434 km) is open May–November; scenic and popular route.
Leh Bus Stand offers buses to Nubra, Pangong, and other local destinations.
Prepaid and shared taxis available for all major routes from Leh.
Bike rentals available in Leh for local and long-distance trips.
Inner Line Permits are issued at the Leh DC Office for Indian nationals.
Auto-rickshaws and shared cabs available for local sightseeing.
Leh to Nubra Valley via Khardung La Pass (120 km, 5-6 hours).
Leh to Pangong Lake via Chang La Pass (150 km, 5-6 hours).
